meanings.definition: A sharp ridge or crease in a surface, especially in a bone or meat.
meanings.sent1: The chine of the bone was visible in the X-ray.
meanings.sent2: The butcher carefully trimmed the chine of the meat.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the chine of the steak looked like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The chine of the cliff cut sharply against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The chine of the knife sliced through the tough meat effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A cut of meat containing part of the backbone.
meanings.sent1: The chine of the pork chop added flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a generous portion of the chine.
meanings.sent3: The chine of the steak seemed to wink at the hungry diner.
meanings.sent4: The chine of the meat held the savory juices within.
meanings.sent5: The chine of the beef was the highlight of the barbecue.
